alert.note: Alert for Bath; Menifee; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Montgomery, northwestern Morgan, Bath, northeastern Menifee and southwestern Rowan Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sharpsburg to Marshall to near Lick Fork. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morehead, Marshall, Polksville, Cogswell, Brandy, Preston, Clearfield, Crix, Bluestone and Freestone around 325 PM EDT. Olympia, Pelfrey, Crooks and Midland around 330 PM EDT. Salt Lick, Lick Fork, Zilpo and Yale around 335 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Olympia Springs, Paragon, Bangor, Craney, Young Springs, Leisure and Blaze. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 115 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
